#Text=Imran
#Text=Ali ( Indian cricketer )
#Text=Imran Ali
#Text=( date of birth unknown ) was an Indian cricketer who played regularly for Vidarbha during the 1960s and 1970s .
#Text=A talented junior player , he toured Ceylon with an India Schools representative side in April 1964 , and made his first-class debut for Vidarbha during the 1964 – 65 season .

#Text=Playing as a middle-order batsman , Imran established himself as a regular player in Vidarbha 's Ranji Trophy team throughout the next decade , and during the 1968 – 69 season even played two matches for Central Zone in the Duleep Trophy , although without much success .
#Text=He retired at the end of the 1976 – 77 season after thirteen seasons for Vidarbha , having captained the side in his final two seasons .
#Text=Cricket career
#Text=Little is known of Imran 's early life , including his date and place of birth . [ 1 ]
#Text=His first matches at higher levels came for a Vidarbha team in the 1962 – 63 and 1963 – 64 editions of the Cooch Behar Trophy , a school-based tournament . [ 2 ]

#Text=His good form for Vidarbha led to his selection first for a Central Zone Schools side , and then for an India Schools side that toured Ceylon ( now Sri Lanka ) in April 1964 , and included future Test cricketers Surinder Amarnath , Ramnath Parkar , Ashok Gandotra , and Eknath Solkar . [ 3 ]
#Text=Imran scored a century in the team 's match against a Jaffna Schools side , an innings of 102 not out batting alongside Ramesh Nagdev , who scored 85 runs . [ 4 ]

#Text=Following on from this good form at junior levels , Imran made his first-class for Vidarbha 's senior side during the 1964 – 65 season of the Ranji Trophy , and went on to play in each of the team 's three matches during the tournament , [ 5 ] scoring his first half-century , an innings of 83 runs , in the final match against Madhya Pradesh . [ 6 ]
#Text=He soon established himself as a regular player in Vidarbha 's side , usually as a middle-order batsman . [ 7 ]
#Text=An innings of 94 runs scored against Rajasthan during the 1968 – 69 season led to Imran 's selection to play for Central Zone in that season 's edition of the Duleep Trophy . [ 8 ]
#Text=However , he played only two matches for Central Zone ( the second against the touring Australians ) , and was not selected in the side in later seasons . [ 5 ]
#Text=Imran remained a consistent , although not outstanding , player for Vidarbha throughout the 1970s .

#Text=Arguably his most successful seasons came towards the middle of the decade : he scored over 200 runs during both the 1974 – 75 and 1975 – 76 seasons , averaging 37.91 runs over both seasons combined . [ 7 ]
#Text=Imran 's only first-class century was an innings of 104 not out scored against Railways in November 1975 .
#Text=This included a 96-run partnership with Sirish Najbile ( 60 runs ) for the fifth wicket . [ 9 ]
#Text=The 1976 – 77 season was Imran 's last at first-class level . [ 5 ]
#Text=For his final two seasons , he replaced Murthy Rajan as captain of Vidarbha , captaining the side in eight matches for five draws and three losses . [ 10 ]
#Text=He finished his career having scored 1,799 runs from 45 first-class matches , at an average of 23.98 . [ 1 ]
